alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Stewart and southwestern Webster Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Lakepoint Resort State Park to near Troutman, and moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Weston, Troutman, Omaha, Kimbrough, Sanford, Westville and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
